comments.body: This is the only thing that I think will cause problems.  I suspect the bots are still on 11.4.

Right. The host app is not currently used by any tests, so that is not an immediate problem. In the past I think the bots have been upgraded to match the latest Xcode out there - ensuring test coverage of the tooling developers are transitioning to.

Xcode 10 has a couple issues that are being fixed, although I think the bigger ones are on the engine side rather than the Flutter side.  This looks good to me, it should be easy to fix if we do end up wanting to use it on a bot before it's upgraded.  Thanks!

Host apps need to add this to work on arm64 macOS.  That's not new to this PR, ~~but this PR actually makes it fail on a non-Apple Silicon device, like our test agents.~~
Edit: that's not true, it won't fail on x86 Macs on this PR.  I forgot I had to change a bunch of settings to force it to fail to test that this worked locally.  You can disregard this comment, this PR doesn't impact host x86 host apps.
